zone.line: infant vows.
But they became every day more
ardent and tender. It was a passion
that had grown with his growth; a it
had become entwined with every faculty
and every sentiment and only to be lost
with life. All None knew of their love
except their own two hearts; ^yet and ^and yet al-
though in all things else, and even in this
he dreaded the censure of his companions,
for thus truly loving one inferior to him in
fortune, yet nothing was ever able to for
shake a moment to sk shake his pur.
pose of uniting himself to her as soon
as he could muster courage to sufficient
to meet those difficulties he was determined
to surmount.
Diana was fully worthy of his deepest
affection. There were few who could boast
of so pure a heart, and so much real
humbleness of soul joined to a firm reliance
on her own integrity and a belief in
that of others. She had from her birth lived
a retired life. She had lost her mother when
very young, but her father had devoted him
